data.text: Folding Chair on Bike Tours: Where to Store the Chair on the Bike?
So who brings a chair. If so what kind and where do you store it?
Helinox Chair Zero, about the same length as my tent poles
data.author: John McAndrew

data.text: Amazon Helinox knock off. I strap it on top of my paniers.
data.author: Todd Ake

data.text: this. Got one of the 22 dollar ones. Works great. Also sometimes strap it to my handlebars
data.author: Devan DeShong

data.text: i do exactly the same with the same seat. It sits on top of my front pannier along with my spare solar panel..
data.author: Paul Wood

data.text: Helinox ground chair, fork bag :)
data.author: Justus Baer

data.text: I have the big Agnes chair and just use the straps that hold my handlebar roll. I can‚Äôt seem to find a picture but as long as the roll weight & the chair is not over the maximum it holds firm. Ôøº
data.author: Bearded Madonna

data.text: I just picked up a Helinox Zero - was tired of sitting on rocks. I plan to carry on a suspension fork mount but haven't successfully fitted it yet
data.author: Mike Kehoe

data.text: Helinox Chair Zero. Best thing ever ! Two of them strapped on the fork with a Versacage.
data.author: Augustin De Bie

data.text: Helinockoff from Amazon. Same size as tent pack and just as light. Both go on the back rack.
data.author: Darcy Clarke

data.text: Helinox too. Only for long trips (more that a couple days)
data.author: Brian Graves

data.text: Helinox zero. Voile strap it on the side of my seat bag. Doubles as structural support for the bag. That and my Yeti coffee mug are my luxury items.
data.author: Dave Campbell

data.text: Same as most here, Helinox chair Zero, depending on which bike I use, either in my dry bag on my Aeroe racks or in my Ortlieb bar roll bag.
data.author: Greg Sorensen

data.text: I use an Alite Monarch if I'm riding my bike with panniers.. but if I'm on my full suspension it's an inflatable REI Flash sit pad.
data.author: Dustin Schulten

data.text: Helinox Ground Chair - slightly heavier than the Chair Zero but has the massive advantage of being useable inside the tent as well. Wouldn't go without it.
data.author: Phil Metcalfe

data.text: I bought the helinox zero and have been on 3 trips since purchasing. Still have yet to pack or bring it with me. üòÉ
data.author: Jerry Duford

data.text: helinox chair one. if you're not a heavy rider like mine, go with the zero. my one luxury item that i won't bikepack without. if you get the helinox make sure you get the footprint that is usually sold separately.
data.author: Straffe Lycke

data.text: The REI version. Not the ultralight one though. I think it‚Äôs 2 pounds, and can withstand my 260 pounds all day long.
data.author: Eric Deady

data.text: Klymit. A chair makes any rest stop feel like home.
data.author: Andy Decker

data.text: I bought the REI Flexlite Air after breaking my Helinox by tripping over it. I find the Flexlite more comfortable, and it looks like REI is having a great sale on them now. I carry it on my front rack with my sleep system.
data.author: Patty Hedges

data.text: I got the Big Agnes chair and it‚Äôs a lifesaver. I can‚Äôt just sit on the ground anymore, kills my hips and knees. I strapped it to my fork leg. Totally worth the pound and half. It‚Äôs on the left leg, hard to see.
data.author: Garth Fenton

data.text: Plus one for the Helinox chair! Strapped to my front fork.
data.author: Shelly Stark
Chris Larner

data.text: Bear vault. In my Bob trailer
data.author: Arie Hoogerbrugge

data.text: Probably wise to create some wider foot supports for most of these chairs if you will be sitting on muddy ground. The legs tend to sink in unexpectedly. Your camping buddies will have a good laugh. The old Alite Monarch was not prone to this, especially when used with the optional front support bar, but alas, is no longer available.
data.author: Pete Mohan

data.text: Helinox chair zero strapped beneath my stem and behind a salsa anything cradle
data.author: Shaun Phillips

data.text: Helinox Zero. Handlebar or frame bag.
data.author: Manu Freeride

data.text: same
data.author: Simon Leicester

data.text: I bring an REI 3 legged camp stool. I put it in my handlebar bag with my tent and other odds and ends.
data.author: Matthew Hall

data.text: Trekology YiziLite and I mount it on the fork rack.
data.author: John Sandlin

data.text: I have a lightweight "backpacking camp chair"
data.author: Brandi Jackson Hodges

data.text: 27quid on Amazon. Same as others that are more than double the price. @1kg. Been faultless as yet. With pockets for your hip flask üëç.
data.author: Andrew Marks

data.text: I have the rei tiny camp chair but I‚Äôm thinking going back to the thermalounger.
data.author: Christian Maurer

data.text: Sea to Summit has a nifty chair that uses their air mattress. So if you happen to have their mattress, that‚Äôs the way to go. Straps easily with the tent poles to the handle bar bag‚Ä¶
data.author: Vincent Klein Breteler

data.text: I'm so into trying to get my kit light that I'm not going to be bringing my bloody chair. I keep that for the local hikes.
data.author: William Hughes

data.text: I have a chamois. Can sit on most things and a hammock for when I‚Äôm feelin fancy
data.author: James Folsom
Derrick Murray

data.text: Helinox ground chair, carry it on my bars or top of my rack.
data.author: Matthew Hall

data.text: Helinox Zero. It fits in one of my fork bags.
data.author: Drew Van Patter

data.text: I‚Äôm old. The type of rides I do, it‚Äôs worth every ounce.
data.author: Andrew Bolton

data.text: fellow bike packer?
data.author: Carleton Blackwell

data.text: My bike has a seat built in
data.author: Jack Driver

data.text: looking at Kilo high back, not sure tho
data.author: Danya Anderson Adams
Taylor Cottrell III

data.text: I was looking at this yesterday‚Ä¶won‚Äôt lie it would be nice to carry a chair
data.author: Wes Mendenhall

data.text: I've thought about this a fair amount also
data.author: Taylor Cottrell III

data.text: Front roll with my hammock. It‚Äôs an REI chair. Works great.
data.author: Bradley Craig

data.text: Just a small foam pad or I carry an old Crazy Creek cushion that I roll up and carry on my fork cages. Yes, I‚Äôm still sitting in the ground but I like the flexibility if the pad to use in my tent or to use it at a picnic table. It‚Äôs also lighter and less to break.
data.author: Roger VanCleave

data.text: The Alite Monarch Butterfly packs into a cylinder of maybe 10 cm √∏ and 30 cm length, very roughly estimated from memory right now. It fits nicely into one of my panniers, and I'd never ever go on tour without it.
data.author: Wilhelm Mellerg√•rd

data.text: In my handle bar harness. Those foldable chairs from REI.
data.author: Matthew Cook

data.text: Big Agnes Skyline. Great chair - solid design, light, comfy. Happily it fits inside my tent bag, and that goes on the back rack. Highly recommend.
data.author: Rick Vandermey

data.text: BTR stool from Hillsound. It fits in my frame bag and deploys in a second. No assembly is required. Great for trailside repairs, a quick break anywhere, and easy to get in and out of at the end of a long day.
data.author: Sue Ross
